meanings.definition: To fail to connect or join properly.
meanings.sent1: I misconnect the puzzle pieces and couldn't finish the picture.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes the internet misconnects and I can't watch videos.
meanings.sent3: I misconnect my headphones and end up listening to music out loud.
meanings.sent4: Her words misconnect with her actions, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The train tracks misconnect, leading to delays in the schedule.

meanings.definition: A failure to make a proper connection or join.
meanings.sent1: The misconnect of the wires caused the device to malfunction.
meanings.sent2: There was a misconnect in the communication, leading to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The misconnect in the plan made everyone laugh at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The misconnect between the gears stopped the machine from working.
meanings.sent5: The misconnect in the friendship left them feeling distant and alone.
